intro: Cyrtandra platyphylla f. ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, thick, and fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
